## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been following the developments in Verus and I was wondering, what are the key updates in Verus Desktop v0.9.5?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus Desktop v0.9.5 introduces two new APIs and CLI commands: `signdata` and `verifysignature`. These updates provide a more powerful and flexible framework for NFTs and ID-bound legal rights and agreements. Additionally, this release updates the Komodo notaries to season 6, which is required to reliably stay synchronized to the Verus mainnet.

**User:**
That's really interesting. What are the new capabilities of the `signdata` and `verifysignature` APIs in Verus Desktop v0.9.5?

**AI Assistant:**
The `signdata` and `verifysignature` APIs in Verus Desktop v0.9.5 enable advanced digital signing and verification capabilities. They allow for easily binding together multiple sources of content, documents, identities, and VDXF keys into one verifiable signature, and then verifying that signature, including all of its specific bindings.

**User:**
I've also heard there are some exciting updates coming to the mainnet. What are some key features of the upcoming Verus PBaaS mainnet upgrade?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, the upcoming Verus PBaaS mainnet upgrade promises to deliver several key features, including no-programming-needed blockchain and currency launches, MEV-free DeFi, and non-custodial Ethereum bridging, among others.

**User:**
I've seen some discussion about improvements to the anti-MEV DeFi protocol. What is the purpose of the protocol improvement introduced by community developers for the Verus anti-MEV DeFi protocol?

**AI Assistant:**
The protocol improvement aims to make the Verus anti-MEV DeFi protocol even more resistant to multi-block attempts at MEV (Maximum Extractable Value). This will enhance the security and efficiency of the protocol.
What are the key updates in Verus Desktop v0.9.5?

Verus Desktop v0.9.5 introduces two new APIs and CLI commands: `signdata` and `verifysignature`. These updates provide a more powerful and flexible framework for NFTs and ID-bound legal rights and agreements. Additionally, this release updates the Komodo notaries to season 6, which is required to reliably stay synchronized to the Verus mainnet.

Title: Jul-Oct 2022 — Verus Monthly Recap
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/jul-oct-2022-verus-monthly-recap-dc7785519867
Content:Jul-Oct 2022 — Verus Monthly Recap
The latest Verus updates on development, community, ecosystem and more. Subscribe to the newsletter here.You can receive the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll keep things short and to the point.
Verus Desktop v0.9.5 Update
⏰ Update your Verus Desktop wallet before 19 November 11 PM UTC. This release updates the Komodo notaries to season 6 and you must update to reliably stay synchronized to the Verus mainnet (activation height of block 2,291,830).
v0.9.5 introduces 2 new APIs and CLI commands, signdata and verifysignature, that encompass all of the capabilities of previous signing and verification APIs and add new capabilities for advanced signatures and verification — a more powerful and flexible framework for NFTs and ID-bound legal rights and agreements.
In addition to digital signing of documents or information using an ID, the new APIs enable easily binding together multiple sources of content, documents, identities, and VDXF keys together into one verifiable signature and then being able to verify that signature, including all of its specific bindings.
🔗 Download Verus Desktop v0.9.5Verus PBaaS & DeFi Updates
In anticipation of the Verus PBaaS mainnet upgrade — delivering no-programming needed blockchain and currency launches, MEV-free DeFi, non-custodial Ethereum bridging and so much more — community developers introduce a protocol improvement designed to make the Verus anti-MEV DeFi protocol even more resistant than what we believe was already the leading algorithm to multi-block attempts at MEV.
The protocol improvement makes the following adjustments:
Conversions and cross-chain transfers still roll-up into exports that are collected from one or more blocks of
What are the new capabilities of the `signdata` and `verifysignature` APIs in Verus Desktop v0.9.5?

The `signdata` and `verifysignature` APIs in Verus Desktop v0.9.5 enable advanced digital signing and verification capabilities. They allow for easily binding together multiple sources of content, documents, identities, and VDXF keys into one verifiable signature, and then verifying that signature, including all of its specific bindings.
